Definition: Adverbial. May be used in the middle construction, such as "this knife cuts well."
Comments: What is Prop? Property? Does not appear on reference page. Also a little confusing since we have a Property predicate.

Definition: Predication, usually a predicate adjective that describes the Result of a Theme.
Comments: Should all be removed now. Changed to ch_of_state path_rel.

Definition: path_rel (618)
Comments: Should all be removed now. Changed to path_rel/location.

Definition: Communication or a social event in relation to a Theme.
Comments: Should we stick with this instead of Topic for the Battle class since we wanted to include physical and non-physical battling?

Definition: An animate Agent or organization abstains from some activity (Theme).
An Agent causes change in a Patient in order to acheive some Goal
An Agent allows an entity Theme to enter a Location.
An Agent or oganization takes on a Theme.
An animate Agent or organization concurs with a Co-Agent about a Topic
An animate Patient is alive at the beginning or end of the event.
An Agent or organization allows a Beneficiary to engage in an activity (Theme).
At the end of an event or as a result of the event, two Patients, or a Patient and Co-Patient, have the property of being apart from each other.
A Theme appears during an event in a Location.
Using an Instrument, heat is applied to a Patient.
An Agent applies a Material to a Patient.
An animate Agent or organization approves a Theme.
An animate Agent or organization assesses a Theme to determine its Attribute/Value.
Arguments: during(E), Agent, Theme, Attribute OR Value

Definition: An Agent attaches a Patient or Co-Patient using an Instrument.
An animate Agent or organization attempts an activity (Theme).
An authority and a subordinate enter into a relationship.
An animate Agent avoids a Theme or Location
An Agent uses a Source as a basis for some Theme.
A Theme begins.
An animate Agent or organization believes a Theme to be in some event or state.
A Beneficiary benefits from some event.
An Agent performs an action or motion with a part of his/her body.
An animate Agent undergoes a bodily process.
An animate Experiencer undergoes a bodily reflex, possibly in response to a Stimulus.
An animate Agent or organization uses a plural Theme or a Theme and a Co-Theme to calculate some result.
A Location has a capacity/can contain a certain amount equal to some Value.
An Affector (Agent, Cause, Stimulus, or Precondition) causes an event.
A Patient moves along a scale in some Direction to attain a new value.
Comments: This predicate takes 3 arguments in caused_calibratable_cos-45.6.2, and 4 arguments in calibratable_cos-45.6.1.

Definition: An animate Agent or organization characterizes a Theme as an Attribute
Comments: Why does the Characterize class include both the Characterize and Describe predicates?

Definition: A human Agent or organization apprehends a human Patient for some crime/Theme.
An animate Agent or organization concludes an activity/Theme from a Source.
A Theme is confined.
An Agent or Co-Agent (animate or organization) engage in conflict.
An animate Agent or organization confronts a Theme, possibly with an Instrument.
An animate Agent or ogranization considers a Theme
Comments: Attribute isn't included in any of the predicates. Add a new predicate or edit this one?

Definition: An animate or organizational Agent(s) conspires against a malefactive, possibly with a Co-Agent.
Two participants come into physical contact.
A Pivot contains a Theme.
An animate Agent or organization causes a Theme, usually an event or situation, to continue. The Theme may continue as some Attribute.
Comments: Sustain-55.6 has E, Agent, Theme, Attribute, and continue-55.3 just includes E, Theme. Revise?

Definition: A Patient is converted from a Source to a Goal.
A Patient is cooked into a certain Form.

Definition: An animate Agent or organization copes with a Theme.
A Theme and Co-Theme correlate or alternate with each other.
The cost of an event or or item is equal to a monetary Asset.
An Agent covers a Patient with a Material.
An Agent creates an image of some Theme.
A human or organizational Agent declares an Undergoer (as some Attribute/Result).
An animate or organizational Agent dedicates a Theme, often reciprocal, to a Goal.
An animate or organizational Agent defends an animate or organizational Beneficiary against some Theme.
An Patient or Co-Patient's wholeness is broken down.
An Agent delays a Theme, usually an event.
A Theme depends on an Agent or Pivot.
An animate or organizational Agent describes a Theme.
Comments: Why are both Characterize and Describe predicates in this class? Use only one?

Definition: An Agent designates an Affector or Undergoer as having some Result, Role, or being some Theme.

Definition: A Patient disappears from an Initial Location during an event

In the arguments: Manner includes Aggressive, Hostile, Forceful, Motion, Illegal, and Deceptive. Participants include Agent, Co-Agent, Theme, Intrument
